basics.name: Jacqueline Isabel Bereska
basics.label: AI and Medical Imaging Researcher
basics.summary: PhD Candidate at the Amsterdam University Medical Centers, specializing in AI and Medical Imaging. Seeking to use problem-solving and coding skills to improve long-term outcome of medical patients.

work.name: Amsterdam University Medical Centers
work.summary: Implementing segmentation and prediction models for pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma and colorectal cancer.
highlights: Serving as a visiting researcher at Verona Pancreas Institute, Oslo University Hospital, and New York University Langone Health for the validation of prediction and segmentation models.
Closely collaborating with radiologists and surgeons on development and implementation of clinically relevant AI tools.

work.name: Utrecht University
work.summary: Exploring and understanding data collected from an ongoing research project in neuropsychology.
highlights: Working with serious VR games used to train important cognitive functions of pediatric patients with traumatic brain injuries.
Visualizing, interpreting, and presenting the collected data to colleagues in Neuropsychology using state-of-the-art data science tools.

work.name: Utrecht University
work.summary: Representing the university at recruiting and introduction events.
highlights: Answering candidates' questions and guiding them through the application process.
Student commissioner on a selection committee tasked with hiring a new assistant professor.

work.name: Utrecht University
work.summary: Supervising and grading students during lab sessions for the lecture 'Machine Learning for Human Vision and Language'.
highlights: Teaching students how to analyze data in R.

work.name: Insiders Technologies
work.summary: Developing and maintaining chatbots in close relationship with individual customers.
highlights: Working on back-end intent classification and entity extraction using Python.
Developing a front-end chatbot-configuration interface using HTML, CSS, JavaScript and the vue.js framework.

courses: Machine Learning for Human Vision and Language
Science de la Vie et de la Terre

awards.title: Prized by German Mathematical Society
awards.summary: Recognized for outstanding performance in mathematics during Abitur.

awards.title: Certificate for outstanding overall grade point achievement in academic year
awards.summary: Recognized for outstanding overall performance during Abitur.

publications.name: Radiomics preoperative-Fistula Risk Score (RAD-FRS) for pancreatoduodenectomy: development and external validation
publications.summary: Development and external validation of a pre-operative radiomics-based fistula risk score for pancreatoduodenectomy, which demonstrated similar predictive performance compared to existing intra-operative fistula risk scores.

publications.name: Artificial intelligence for assessment of vascular involvement and tumor resectability on CT in patients with pancreatic cancer
publications.summary: Development of a model using CT images to accurately assess vascular involvement and tumor resectability in patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.

publications.name: Improving the Reliability of Medical Diagnostic Models through Rule-Based Decision Deferral
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the Inaugural 2023 Summer Symposium Series 2023
publications.summary: Proposed a rule-based decision deferral framework to enhance the reliability of medical diagnostic models by identifying and deferring uncertain predictions to human experts.
